data.enText: to bring two or more people together again after they have been separated for a long time; to come together again

data.chText: 昨天晚上，她和她的子女团聚。
data.enText: Last night she was reunited with her children.

data.chText: 战争过后，一家人又相聚了。
data.enText: The family was reunited after the war.

data.chText: 有传言说这个乐队将复合作一次环球巡演。
data.enText: There have been rumours that the band will reunite for a world tour.
to join together again separate areas or separate groups within an organization, a political party, etc.; to come together again

data.chText: 作为领导，他的主要目标就是要使党内各派团结起来。
data.enText: As leader, his main aim is to reunite the party.

tr: unify again, as of a country

value.def: If people are reunited, or if they reunite, they meet each other again after they have been separated for some time.

example.ex: She and her youngest son were finally allowed to be reunited with their family...
example.tran: 她和小儿子终于得到允许和家人团聚。

example.ex: She spent the post-war years of her marriage trying to reunite father and son...
example.tran: 在战后几年的婚姻生活中，她千方百计想让父子团聚。

example.ex: The band will reunite for this show only.
example.tran: 乐队的重聚仅仅是为了这场演出。

value.def: If a divided organization or country is reunited, or if it reunites, it becomes one united organization or country again.

example.ex: ...a federation under which the divided island would be reunited...
example.tran: 将使这个分裂的岛屿实现统一的联邦政府

example.ex: His first job will be to reunite the army.
example.tran: 他的首要任务将是使军队重新团结一心。
当东德和西德实现统一的时候
